did.abstract: Scattered personal correspondence concerning family affairs and the sale of slaves of a wealthy Charleston physician engaged in some undefined occupation during the Civil War, probably blockade running. In an 1863 letter, Gibbes' wife, Amelia, wrote of how badly he had treated her. In 1860 Gibbes was listed as possessing over $15,000 in real estate and 25 enslaved persons.
